critique: This document is an executive order by President Harding in 1922, authorizing the American Relief Administration to distribute medical supplies to famine-stricken Russia. It is based on an Act of Congress, so it is not an overreach of executive power. It involves government in economic matters by allocating resources, but it is for humanitarian aid. It promotes social inclusion by helping people in need, regardless of their background. There is no information about immigration, federalism, or national security vs. civil liberties. Therefore, these axes should be neutral.
